abstract: China formally arrested an Australian citizen and three other employees of the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto on suspicions of commercial bribery and trade secrets infringement in a case that has rocked the global steel industry and created a diplomatic uproar.
snippet: China formally arrested an Australian citizen and three other employees of the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto on suspicions of commercial bribery and trade secrets infringement in a case that has rocked the global steel industry and cre...
lead_paragraph: China formally arrested an Australian citizen and three other employees of the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto late Tuesday on suspicions of commercial bribery and trade secrets infringement in a case that has rocked the global steel industry and created a diplomatic uproar, David Barboza reported in The New York Times.

headline.main: China Charges 4 Rio Tinto Employees, but Backs Off
